javaMail

Class EmailClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaMail.EmailClient

  • public class EmailClient
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.HashMap<javax.mail.Flags,java.lang.String> extraFlags 
      private com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPFolder folder 
      private java.lang.String password 
      private javax.mail.Session session 
      private java.lang.String smtphost 
      private javax.mail.Store store 
      private java.lang.String username 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EmailClient()
      Creates a new EmailClient object which is capable of connecting to an email (setUpUser), sending an email (sendEmail), getting all of the email from the email (getMail), ending the connection (endConnection), normalising flags, reading the content of an email and adding custom flags.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCustomFlags(java.lang.String flag, java.lang.String keywords)
      This method allows us to add in custom user-defined flags into our email, so that the GUI can display them.
      void endConnection()
      Ends the connection to the email.
      javax.mail.Message[] getMail()
      This method returns all of the Messages inside the mailbox of the email we are connected to.
      java.lang.String normaliseFlags(javax.mail.Message m)
      Sets all the flags ready for display in the GUI.
      java.lang.String readBody(javax.mail.Part m)
      This method reads the body of an email and returns it in String form; this is used for the DisplaySingleEmail class so that the user can view emails including their content.
      void sendEmail(java.lang.String receiver, java.lang.String cc, java.lang.String bcc, java.lang.String subject, java.lang.String content, java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> attachments)
      This method is used to send an email using the parameters and the methods; it allows the user to include attachments.
      void setUpUser()
      This method sets up a new user using the email that has been hardcoded, and asks the user to input the password for this email.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • EmailClient

        public EmailClient()
            throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Creates a new EmailClient object which is capable of connecting to an email (setUpUser), sending an email (sendEmail), getting all of the email from the email (getMail), ending the connection (endConnection), normalising flags, reading the content of an email and adding custom flags.
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException

    • Method Detail

      • setUpUser

        public void setUpUser()
               throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        This method sets up a new user using the email that has been hardcoded, and asks the user to input the password for this email.
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException

      • sendEmail

        public void sendEmail(java.lang.String receiver,
             java.lang.String cc,
             java.lang.String bcc,
             java.lang.String subject,
             java.lang.String content,
             java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> attachments)
        This method is used to send an email using the parameters and the methods; it allows the user to include attachments.
        Parameters:
        receiver - - the person we want to send the email to
        cc - - anyone we want to cc the email to
        bcc - - anyone we want to bcc the email to
        subject - - the subject of the email
        content - - the content of the email
        attachments - - the attachments (if there are any)

      • getMail

        public javax.mail.Message[] getMail()
                             throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        This method returns all of the Messages inside the mailbox of the email we are connected to.
        Returns:
        An Array of Messages from the email we are connected to.
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException

      • endConnection

        public void endConnection()
                   throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Ends the connection to the email.
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException

      • normaliseFlags

        public java.lang.String normaliseFlags(javax.mail.Message m)
                                throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Sets all the flags ready for display in the GUI.
        Parameters:
        m - - the message in question that we want to set the readable flag for.
        Returns:
        - the string of the readable flag
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException

      • readBody

        public java.lang.String readBody(javax.mail.Part m)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 javax.mail.MessagingException
        This method reads the body of an email and returns it in String form; this is used for the DisplaySingleEmail class so that the user can view emails including their content.
        Parameters:
        m - - the message we want to read the content of
        Returns:
        A string value of the content of the email
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        javax.mail.MessagingException

      • addCustomFlags

        public void addCustomFlags(java.lang.String flag,
                  java.lang.String keywords)
                    throws javax.mail.MessagingException,
                           java.io.IOException
        This method allows us to add in custom user-defined flags into our email, so that the GUI can display them.
        Parameters:
        flag - - the custom flag that we want to add
        keywords - - the keywords that we want to be associated with the new custom flag
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException
        java.io.IOException
